content.description: Rachel’s Hospital Room, Ross is sitting next to Rachel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You said you’d marry Joey?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay you have to realize, I was exhausted, I was emotional, I would have said yes to anybody. Like that time you and I got married! (Pause) I’m not helping.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So you said yes to him, and you just had our baby?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That is right and traditionally the daddy is supposed to give the mummy a present but I am prepared to let that go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So when I came in here to see if you wanted to maybe start things up again, you were engaged to my best friend.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well—Really? I thought Chandler was your best friend.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, Chandler’s my oldest friend, but Joey’s my—No! Ah! (points at Rachel)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooooo!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey you guys I’m gonna take off. I just wanted to let you guys know, say goodbye.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rachel said she’d marry you?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This isn’t the right room, sorry folks. (leaves)

content.description: Ross and Rachel’s, Monica, Phoebe, Joey and Chandler are waiting for Ross and Rachel to come home and Monica is looking at the sign Phoebe bought that says, “It’s a Boy!”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, I don’t wanna be negative so I’ll say that most of the signs you bought are good.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No they ran out of “It’s a girl” but I can fix this one, (She writes “not” in between it’s and a) See?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So sexy. (Waking him up.) Honey.
content.parenthetical: looking at Chandler sleeping with a balloon in his mouth

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yea yea. (Pulls the balloon out of his mouth)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey why don’t you go lie down.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no, Ross and Rachel will be back soon and then I gotta go to the office (Pulls another balloon out of his mouth) Am I producing them?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why’re you so tired?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Couldn’t sleep last night you know, then I started worrying about this big divisional meeting that I have later today, the more I worried about it the more I couldn’t sleep.  Y’know? I was like, if I fall asleep now I’ll get six hours sleep, but if I fall asleep now I’ll get five hours sleep. Not matter what I did I couldn’t fall asleep.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You know what you should’ve done, you should have told yourself that little story.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Everyone
content.text: Hi, welcome home!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe did the signs!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh you guys thanks for doing this.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Look at all the stuff people sent!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Ah! (Sees a big stuffed gorilla) Oh my gosh there’s something every mother needs, a giant stuffed gorilla that takes up the entire apartment! What are people think… (Reads the card) Oh you guys I love it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey so where’s Ross?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He’s downstairs getting the rest of the stuff out of the cab.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is he still mad at us?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, you more then me, but he can’t stay to mad at me. I mean, I just had his baby.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s not fair! I can’t do that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I’m not so sure you should be here when he comes up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See this is what I was afraid of, I didn’t think I should be here either but somebody (Looks at Chandler) said he’d be over it by now.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, what do I know? I wanted to get a bigger gorilla.

content.description: A Boardroom, Chandler keeps drifting off to sleep at his meeting.

content.speaker: Ms. McKenna
content.text: The numbers we are seeing New York, Chicago, and London are consistently solid, but many of our officers have reported disappointing fields.
(Chandler drifts off and his arm slips off the table and he wakes back up.)

content.speaker: Ms. McKenna
content.text: Boston is down, Atlanta is down, Houston is down, I could go on and on but instead of boring you I’ll go straight to my forty two point plan.
(Chandler leans over to fall asleep on the man’s shoulder next to him, only the man catches his attempt.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Walter (nods).

content.description: Ross and Rachel’s, Phoebe, Monica, Ross, and Rachel are watching Emma sleep.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She’s just so cute! I just wanna bite her ear off and use it and a sucking candy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe! But I could take one of those little feet and put it in a pita pocket.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay I put most of the stuff away.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh great, the pacifiers?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: In the closet.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: The burping clogs?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Linen closet.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: The diapers?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: In the hospital.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow you guys got a hospital?  Fancy!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No I left the diapers at the hospital! There’s some in the bag but I’ll run out and get some more.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Alright thanks, oh Ross could you stop by the coffee house and get me a muffin?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure what kind?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm let me think...What do I want, what d-o I w-a-n-t...

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Please take your time, it’s an important decision. Not like, say, I know! deciding to marry someone, this is about a muffin.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Blueberry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Blueberry it is.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow, he’s really not letting this go, is he?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: God how long do you think that’s gonna last?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I dunno, well he got over the “We were on a break” thing really quickly.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know I can’t even worry about that right now, cause I got the cutie little baby, oh I can’t believe how much I love her, I can’t get enough of her, like right now I miss her.  I actually miss her.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You know that’s… that’s her.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh god look at her sleeping.  Oh, I love her so much!  Oh, I think I’m gonna wake her up.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no, Rach, no no, you know you’re never supposed to wake a sleeping baby.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well I can do whatever I want!  I made her! (Waking Emma up.) Come on little girl, hi!
(Emma starts crying)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can say I told you so but she’s kinda doing that for me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh I’m sorry mummy’s so sorry go back to sleep go back to sleep. Shh.   Shhh! Go back to sleep
(Emma continues crying in the background)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Breaks your heart doesn’t it

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It really does… how long do you think we have to stay?

content.speaker: Ms. McKenna
content.text: Ok if everyone’s on board, it’s settled, Chandler, (Walter puts his hand on Chandlers hand, Chandler sleeping puts his hand on top of his, he then wakes up and pulls his hand away) Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yep.

content.speaker: Ms. McKenna
content.text: Are you on board?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes.
content.parenthetical: not knowing what he’s saying yes to

content.speaker: Ms. McKenna
content.text: Then, problem solved. Chandler will be running our office in Tulsa. You’re gonna love Oklahoma.
(Chandler smiles and nods then realizes what he’s agreed to.)

content.description: Ross and Rachel’s, Emma continues crying while Rachel, Monica and Phoebe try different methods to stop her crying.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, alright, we already tried feeding her, changing her, burping her, oh try this one! Go back in time and listen to Phoebe!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright here’s something, it says to try holding the baby close to your body and then swing her rapidly from side to side.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok. (Starts swinging Emma rapidly and she stops crying)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It worked!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh (happy) oh no just stopped to throw up a little bit. (Emma starts crying again.) Oh come on, what am I gonna do, its been hours and it won’t stop crying.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, she Rach, not it, she.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I’m not so sure.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my god, I am losing my mind.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, no kidding, this just proves no good can come from having sex with Ross!

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is getting Rachel’s muffin.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Gunther, can I get a couple of blueberry muffins to go? (He puts a bag with diapers in it on the counter.)

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Diapers huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yep.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: So I guess Rachel had you baby?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yep, can you believe it?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Nope!  I still can’t believe she slept with you in the first place.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh? Ooh (laughs) you mean like a… Huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey. (Ross turns to see who it is, and seeing it’s Joey he just ignores him and turns back around.) Ross, I know you’re pissed at me, but we have to talk about this.
Ross: Ah actually we don’t. (Ross walks off)
Joey: Fine, fine okay. But I gotta say technically, I didn’t even do anything wrong.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What! (Angrily) You didn’t do anything wrong?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I said I didn’t technically.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay let’s put aside that you (Makes quote marks with his fingers.) “accidentally” picked up my grandmothers ring and you (Does it again) “accidentally” proposed to Rachel.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, can I just stop you right there for a second? When people do this (Makes quote marks with his fingers.) I don’t really know what that means. (Ross just looks at him) You were saying?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And I can even understand that you couldn’t tell Rachel, but why couldn’t you tell me, huh? You had all day to and you didn’t.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know I should’ve. (Makes quote marks again.) “I’m sorry.”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not using it right, Joe.
(He brings his hands in closer to his face then does it again.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m gonna go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, come on Ross! (He grabs his bag so he can’t leave) Look, Ross, we have to get past this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Give me the bag.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, look, I don’t know what else to do. I said I’m sorry!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You should scream at me, or-or-or curse me, or hit me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m not gonna hit you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why not?  You’ll feel better!  I’ll feel better, and you know you want to. I can see it in your eyes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No I don’t.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: A little bit.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Little bit.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: A little bit more.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Give me the bag.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, hit me

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Give me the bag.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hit me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, give me the bag.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hit me!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joe I’m not kidding…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hit me, hit me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hit me! Hit me!
(Ross throws a punch, but Joey ducks and Ross punches the pole. Ross then screams from the pain and turns to Gunther, and Gunther has a huge smile on his face.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You ducked!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m sorry! It was a reflex!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my god, this really hurts!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I couldn’t help it! When a fist comes at your face, you duck! Look! (He goes to punch Ross, expecting him to duck, but he doesn’t and Joey punches Ross.   Gunther is amused.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What is the matter with you?!?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You were supposed to duck!!! Why didn’t you duck?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why don’t we talk about this on the way to the hospital?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good, good yeah, (Grabs the bags) maybe while we’re there, they can check your reflexes. (Joey opens the door and it hits Ross in the face with it.) (Makes quote marks.) “Oops.”

content.description: Ross and Rachel’s, Emma is still crying.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Try feeding her again.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I already fed her.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know, that’s why I said again!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright you guys, we can’t turn on each other, Okay?  That’s just what she wants.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica can I talk to you outside for a minute?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no, you guys, just stay here, I’m gonna go check her diaper, Pheebs you wanna come?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh I’m kinda part of this.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Actually Pheebs its more of a husband and wife kinda thing

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I knew I should have married Chandler.
(Phoebe and Rachel go to the back room and Emma continues to cry in the background while Chandler and Monica talk.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay what’s up

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Umm, you know how we always said that it would be fun to move to Paris for a year? You know, you could study French cooking and I could write and we could take a picnic along the Seine and go wine tasting in Bordeaux?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah (smiles).

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, you know how that people say that Tulsa is the Paris of Oklahoma?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What? Who says that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: People who’ve never ever been to Paris.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We’re moving to Tulsa! (Makes a excited expression on his face)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Excuse me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, Ms. McKenna, she kind of works above my boss, she asked me to move to Tulsa and be the president of our office there, and I was sleeping and apparently, said yes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Tulsa, Oklahoma!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The Sooner State, whatever that is.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, I don’t even wanna see the musical Oklahoma!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really? Oh What A Beautiful Morning !  Surrey With A Fringe On Top .

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you trying to tell me that we’re moving to Oklahoma, or that you’re gay? All right, not that this matters, but did they at least offer you a huge raise?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no, but they are going to lease us a Ford Focus. (Monica’s not impressed.) I’ll get out of it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What is wrong with Emma?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh she misunderstood, she thought she was moving to Tulsa.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Umm ma’am, do you have a minute? (She points for him to come in) I kind of have some bad news. I don’t think I can move to Tulsa.

content.speaker: Ms. McKenna
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s a funny story, actually. (coughs) I kind of fell asleep in the meeting this morning so when I said I’d move to Tulsa, I didn’t really know what I was saying.

content.speaker: Ms. McKenna
content.text: You fell asleep?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But only because I was up all night worried about this meeting, ain’t that funny? Irony? Not a fan, alright (he sits down). See, here’s the thing. I went home and told my wife about Tulsa and she won’t go. See, me, I love Tulsa!  Tulsa is heaven!  Tulsa is Italy—Please don’t make me go there!

content.speaker: Ms. McKenna
content.text: Chandler, I…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No no no! Look, Carol, can I call you Carol? (Pause) Wh-why would I when your name is Elaine? Oh what a great picture of your son, strapping! (She glares at him.) That’s a picture of your daughter, isn’t it, well she’s lovely. I like a girl with a strong jaw. I’ll call you from Tulsa. (Exits.)

content.description: The Hospital, Joey is sitting in the lobby as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, so how is it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I broke my thumb.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Your thumb? That’s weird. (Makes a fist.) You sure you’re punching right? Make a fist. (Ross just looks at him with his thumb in a cast.) Maybe later. Ross I feel terrible.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know what, you can go, I just have to fill out some forms. (Tries to hold the pen but can’t)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You, you want me to help you with that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why, does it look like I’m having trouble with my misshapen claw? (He hands Joey the form)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Name? (Ross looks at him.) I know Ross but what’s it short for? You know like, like Rossel or Rosstepher.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just Ross!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s pretty, Okay date of birth?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know my birthday.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure, May...tember.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: October 18th.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Occupation? Dinosaurs.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Actually I’m a palian… Dinosaurs is fine… the drawing is not.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright, who do you want as your emergency contact?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah, Rachel I guess.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, relationship, boy this could take a while.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just ah… just put roommate.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on, you guys are more then that! I mean, you’re gonna get together right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t think that we are.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But you two were supposed to be together.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I thought so too, but then she said she’d marry you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on, Ross, that didn’t mean anything! She just had the baby, she was all freaked out about doing it alone, she would have said yes to anybody.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah that’s what she said.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So I don’t wanna be just anybody.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know what, it’s, it’s better this way anyway. I mean I don’t know what I was thinking, going down that road again with us. It’s just much easier if we’re just friends who have a kid.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And you’re Okay with that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes. I mean, it’s what we always planned.  And if you have a plan, you should stick to it.  That’s why they call them plans.  Hello? (Pause) I’m fine.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, for what it’s worth, with Rachel I don’t think you’ll ever be just (Makes quote marks.) “anybody.”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey there you go! (Smiles because Joey used it correctly)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: “Thanks.”
(Ross looks away, not bothering)

content.description: Ross and Rachel’s, Emma continues to cry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! How long has she been crying?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: About a week and a half.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well alright, looks like you guys have got it under control so I’m just gonna go. (She gets up and Rachel looks at her, upset, and Monica just stares.) No! Really? Misery really does love company. All right! (She sits back down.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach, try holding her a different way.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You guys, I’m doing the best I can, anyone else is welcome to try.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright, I’ll try, fine! Yes, Okay!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Here you go. (Hands Emma to Phoebe)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Shh! Nothing works with this child! (Hands her back.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh god what am I gonna do you guys, I can’t even comfort my own baby! I’m the worst mother ever!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re just new at this, it’ll get better, think about your first day at work. I mean, that couldn’t have been easy but you figured that out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah I don’t think dressing provocatively is going to help me here! Oh my god just please take her.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay I’ll take her, here. (Takes Emma)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I have to go to the bathroom. (Goes to the bathroom)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I have to go scream into a pillow. (Goes to scream into a pillow)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bouncy baby, Bouncy baby, Ooh baby baby, Ooh baby baby, Ooh baby baby. (Emma stops crying and falls asleep)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Have I gone deaf?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It worked! Ooh baby baby baby, ooh baby baby baby!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You must be a fireball in bed.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe it!  She’s asleep!  I got her to go to sleep!   I have actual magical powers!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can hear traffic and birds!  I can hear the voices in my head again! (Monica looks at her strangely) I’m kidding. (She smiles wickedly.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! You got her to stop crying!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes I did, I’m Monica, Super Aunt

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You are the official baby crier stopper!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes I am!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re never leaving the apartment!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Say what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s your new job, day and night, she starts crying I need you here.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no no no no!
content.parenthetical: stands up to hand Emma back

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thankfully you don’t need me at all (gets up and to leave) so Okay Super aunt see you later! Rachel let’s give it six to eight months (she leaves).

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay so listen I’m gonna go lay down.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You know the book says that whenever she’s sleeping I should be sleeping so… (She gives Monica thumbs and goes to lay down)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Shhh! We just got her to go to sleep

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh so there can’t be any yelling.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We’re moving to Tulsa

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What!?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Shhhh! Shhhhh! Shhhhh! Shhhhh! (Walks backwards towards the door) I can’t, I can’t hear you. (He runs out)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Heeeeey, where have you been? (He shows her his thumb) What happened to you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah I had a little thing with Joey, if you think this is bad you should see him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no Ross! This is not good, we have to talk about this Joey thing. Please sit. (He sits) You have got to get over this Joey thing, okay? I never really wanted to marry Joey, okay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You know what I really really want?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, Rach?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I wanna sleep, I wanna eat, I wanna take a shower, I mean before she wakes up and we gotta do this all over again.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean I got news for you mister, Emma?  Not easy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, that’s what I’m here for. (Emma starts crying again) Want me to get that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No its really okay… Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Got it! Got it! Got it! Got it! Got it! Got it!
content.parenthetical: comes running out the kitchen to the bedroom

content.description: Central Perk, Joey and Ross are sitting at one of the high tables.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You know, ah, I’ve been thinking about this and I gotta tell ya, it’s not my fault. It’s a natural instinct.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, what you guys talking about?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey OK great, what would you do if I did this? (Swings to punch Chandler, he moves and he ends up punching Ross, knocking him off the stool. Ross then gets up and just stares at Joey.)
